abstract: The two-hour season finale of “Grey’s Anatomy” vaulted ABC to No. 1 in the ratings on Thursday, attracting 17.8 million viewers from 9 to 11 p.m., according to Nielsen’s estimates. Although the number of viewers for the show’s fourth season conclusion declined nearly 5 million compared to a year ago (22.6 million), it still led the night by a wide margin over its nearest competitor, NBC’s “Deal or No Deal,” which garnered 10.3 million viewers from 8 to 9:30 p.m.
lead_paragraph: The two-hour season finale of “Grey’s Anatomy” vaulted ABC to No. 1 in the ratings on Thursday, attracting 17.8 million viewers from 9 to 11 p.m., according to Nielsen’s estimates. Although the number of viewers for the show’s fourth season conclusion declined nearly 5 million compared to a year ago (22.6 million), it still led the night by a wide margin over its nearest competitor, NBC’s “Deal or No Deal,” which garnered 10.3 million viewers from 8 to 9:30 p.m.
